summary.span: 提供泛型集合的基类。

span.span: Provides the base class for a generic collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 通过创建一个构造类型的实例，可以立即使用 类;只需指定要包含在集合中的对象的类型。The class can be used immediately by creating an instance of one of its constructed types; all you have to do is specify the type of object to be contained in the collection. 此外，你可以从任何构造的类型派生你自己的集合类型，或者从 类本身派生泛型集合类型。In addition, you can derive your own collection type from any constructed type, or derive a generic collection type from the class itself. 类提供受保护的方法，这些方法可用于自定义添加和移除项、清除集合或设置现有项的值时的行为。The class provides protected methods that can be used to customize its behavior when adding and removing items, clearing the collection, or setting the value of an existing item. 大多数 对象都可以修改。Most objects can be modified. 但是，不能修改使用只读 对象初始化的 对象。However, a object that is initialized with a read-only object cannot be modified. 有关此类的只读版本，请参阅 。See for a read-only version of this class. 可以使用整数索引访问此集合中的元素。Elements in this collection can be accessed using an integer index. 此集合中的索引从零开始。Indexes in this collection are zero-based. 接受 `null` 作为引用类型的有效值，并允许重复元素。 accepts `null` as a valid value for reference types and allows duplicate elements. ## Examples 本部分包含两个代码示例。This section contains two code examples. 第一个示例演示 类的多个属性和方法。The first example demonstrates several properties and methods of the class. 第二个示例演示如何从 的构造类型派生集合类，以及如何重写 的受保护方法以提供自定义行为。The second example shows how to derive a collection class from a constructed type of , and how to override the protected methods of to provide custom behavior. 示例 1Example 1 下面的代码示例演示了 的多个属性和方法。The following code example demonstrates many of the properties and methods of . 此代码示例创建一个字符串集合，使用 方法添加多个字符串，显示 并列出字符串。The code example creates a collection of strings, uses the method to add several strings, displays the , and lists the strings. 该示例使用 方法查找字符串的索引，并使用 方法来确定字符串是否在集合中。The example uses the method to find the index of a string and the method to determine whether a string is in the collection. 该示例使用 方法插入字符串，并使用默认的 属性（中C#的索引器）检索和设置字符串。The example inserts a string using the method and retrieves and sets strings using the default property (the indexer in C#). 该示例使用 方法和使用 方法的索引按字符串标识删除字符串。The example removes strings by string identity using the method and by index using the method. 最后，使用 方法从集合中清除所有字符串。Finally, the method is used to clear all strings from the collection. [!code-cpp[ObjectModel.Collection#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/ObjectModel.Collection/cpp/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[ObjectModel.Collection#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/ObjectModel.Collection/cs/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[ObjectModel.Collection#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/ObjectModel.Collection/VB/source.vb#1)] 示例 2Example 2 下面的代码示例演示如何从 泛型类的构造类型派生集合类，以及如何重写受保护的 、、和 方法，以便为 、、和 方法提供自定义行为，并设置 属性。The following code example shows how to derive a collection class from a constructed type of the generic class, and how to override the protected , , , and methods to provide custom behavior for the , , , and methods, and for setting the property. 此示例提供的自定义行为是在每个受保护的方法末尾引发 `Changed` 通知事件。The custom behavior provided by this example is a `Changed` notification event that is raised at the end of each of the protected methods. `Dinosaurs` 类继承 `Collection` （`Collection(Of String)` Visual Basic）并定义 `Changed` 事件，该事件使用 `DinosaursChangedEventArgs` 类作为事件信息，并使用枚举来标识更改类型。The `Dinosaurs` class inherits `Collection` (`Collection(Of String)` in Visual Basic) and defines the `Changed` event, which uses a `DinosaursChangedEventArgs` class for the event information, and an enumeration to identify the kind of change. 此代码示例调用多个 属性和方法来演示自定义事件。The code example calls several properties and methods of to demonstrate the custom event. threadsafe.span: 此类型的公共静态（ Visual Basic）成员是线程安全的。

span.span: Public static ( in Visual Basic) members of this type are thread safe.

threadsafe.span: 但不保证所有实例成员都是线程安全的。

span.span: Any instance members are not guaranteed to be thread safe.

threadsafe.span: 只要没有修改集合， 就可以同时支持多个读取器。

span.span: A can support multiple readers concurrently, as long as the collection is not modified.

threadsafe.span: 尽管如此，枚举集合本身并不是一个线程安全的过程。

span.span: Even so, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure.

threadsafe.span: 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。

span.span: To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration.

threadsafe.span: 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。

span.span: To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization.

para.span: 提供此基类是为了使实现者可以更轻松地创建自定义集合。

span.span: This base class is provided to make it easier for implementers to create a custom collection.

para.span: 鼓励实现者扩展此基类，而不是自行创建。

span.span: Implementers are encouraged to extend this base class instead of creating their own.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果 对象是使用无参数构造函数创建的，则此方法将使用默认的相等比较器 来确定是否 `T`（列表中的值的类型）的相等性。If the object is created using the parameterless constructor, this method determines equality using the default equality comparer for `T`, the type of values in the list. 如果类型 `T` 未实现 接口，则使用 方法。If type `T` does not implement the interface, the method is used. 如果通过将 对象传递到构造函数来创建集合对象，则 方法将由该 对象使用的 接口确定。If the Collection object is created by passing an object to the constructor, the method will be determined by the interface used by that object. 此方法执行线性搜索;因此，平均执行时间与 成正比。This method performs a linear search; therefore, the average execution time is proportional to . 也就是说，此方法是一个 O （`n`）操作，其中 `n` 是 的。That is, this method is an O(`n`) operation, where `n` is .

summary.span: 返回循环访问 的枚举器。

span.span: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the .
An for the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks C#语言的 `foreach` 语句（`for each` 中C++`For Each` Visual Basic）隐藏了枚举器的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of the enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 在此位置上，未定义 。At this position, is undefined. 因此，在读取 的值之前，必须调用 将枚举器向前移动到集合的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 在调用 之前， 返回相同的对象。 returns the same object until is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果 越过集合的末尾，则枚举器将定位到集合中的最后一个元素之后， 返回 `false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举器位于此位置时，对 的后续调用也将返回 `false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 如果对的最后一个调用 返回 `false`，则 未定义。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 无法再次将 设置为集合的第一个元素；必须改为创建新的枚举器实例。You cannot set to the first element of the collection again; you must create a new enumerator instance instead. 只要集合保持不变，枚举器就仍有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果对集合进行更改（如添加、修改或删除元素），则枚举数将失效且不可恢复，而且其行为是不确定的。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and its behavior is undefined. 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 不同步 中集合的默认实现。Default implementations of collections in are not synchronized. 此方法为 O （1）操作。This method is an O(1) operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 将从第一个元素开始向前搜索 ，并在最后一个元素结束。The is searched forward starting at the first element and ending at the last element. 此方法使用默认的相等比较器 来确定 `T`（列表中值的类型）的相等性。This method determines equality using the default equality comparer for `T`, the type of values in the list. 此方法执行线性搜索;因此，平均执行时间与 成正比。This method performs a linear search; therefore, the average execution time is proportional to . 也就是说，此方法是一个 O （`n`）操作，其中 `n` 是 的。That is, this method is an O(`n`) operation, where `n` is . ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示了 的多个属性和方法。The following code example demonstrates many of the properties and methods of . 此代码示例创建一个字符串集合，使用 方法添加多个字符串，显示 并列出字符串。The code example creates a collection of strings, uses the method to add several strings, displays the , and lists the strings. 该示例使用 方法查找字符串的索引，并使用 方法来确定字符串是否在集合中。The example uses the method to find the index of a string and the method to determine whether a string is in the collection. 该示例使用 方法插入字符串，并使用默认的 属性（中C#的索引器）检索和设置字符串。The example inserts a string using the method and retrieves and sets strings using the default property (the indexer in C#). 该示例使用 方法和使用 方法的索引按字符串标识删除字符串。The example removes strings by string identity using the method and by index using the method. 最后，使用 方法从集合中清除所有字符串。Finally, the method is used to clear all strings from the collection. remarks.format: ## Remarks 接受 `null` 作为引用类型的有效值，并允许重复元素。 accepts `null` as a valid value for reference types and allows duplicate elements. 此方法为 O （1）操作。This method is an O(1) operation. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何从 泛型类的构造类型派生集合类，以及如何重写受保护的 、、和 方法，以便为 、、和 方法提供自定义行为，并设置 属性。The following code example shows how to derive a collection class from a constructed type of the generic class, and how to override the protected , , , and methods to provide custom behavior for the , , , and methods, and for setting the property. 此示例提供的自定义行为是在每个受保护的方法末尾引发 `Changed` 通知事件。The custom behavior provided by this example is a `Changed` notification event that is raised at the end of each of the protected methods. `Dinosaurs` 类继承 `Collection` （`Collection(Of String)` Visual Basic）并定义 `Changed` 事件，该事件使用 `DinosaursChangedEventArgs` 类作为事件信息，并使用枚举来标识更改类型。The `Dinosaurs` class inherits `Collection` (`Collection(Of String)` in Visual Basic) and defines the `Changed` event, which uses a `DinosaursChangedEventArgs` class for the event information, and an enumeration to identify the kind of change. 此代码示例调用多个 属性和方法来演示自定义事件。The code example calls several properties and methods of to demonstrate the custom event. remarks.format: ## Remarks 在创建只读集合后，该集合不允许添加、移除或修改元素。A collection that is read-only does not allow the addition, removal, or modification of elements after the collection is created. 只读集合就是一个集合，其中包含阻止修改集合的包装器;因此，如果对基础集合进行了更改，只读集合将反映这些更改。A collection that is read-only is simply a collection with a wrapper that prevents modifying the collection; therefore, if changes are made to the underlying collection, the read-only collection reflects those changes. 检索此属性的值的运算复杂度为 O(1)。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(1) operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 不同步 中集合的默认实现。Default implementations of collections in are not synchronized. 枚举整个集合本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 返回一个对象，该对象可用于同步对 的访问。 returns an object that can be used to synchronize access to the . 仅当所有线程在访问集合之前锁定此对象时，同步才有效。Synchronization is effective only if all threads lock this object before accessing the collection. 检索此属性的值的运算复杂度为 O(1)。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(1) operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks C#语言的 `foreach` 语句（`for each` 中C++`For Each` Visual Basic）隐藏了枚举器的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of the enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 也会将枚举器放回此位置。 also brings the enumerator back to this position. 在此位置上，未定义 。At this position, is undefined. 因此，在读取 的值之前，必须调用 将枚举器向前移动到集合的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 在调用 或 之前， 返回同一对象。 returns the same object until either or is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果 越过集合的末尾，则枚举器将定位到集合中的最后一个元素之后， 返回 `false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举器位于此位置时，对 的后续调用也将返回 `false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 如果对的最后一个调用 返回 `false`，则 未定义。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 若要再次将 设置为集合的第一个元素，可以调用 并接着调用 。To set to the first element of the collection again, you can call followed by . 只要集合保持不变，枚举器就仍有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果对集合进行更改（如添加、修改或删除元素），则枚举数将失效且不可恢复，而且其行为是不确定的。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and its behavior is undefined. 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 不同步 中集合的默认实现。Default implementations of collections in are not synchronized. 此方法为 O （1）操作。This method is an O(1) operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 具有固定大小的集合在创建之后不能再添加或移除元素，但是允许修改现有元素。A collection with a fixed size does not allow the addition or removal of elements after the collection is created, but it allows the modification of existing elements. 具有固定大小的集合就是一个集合，其中包含阻止添加和移除元素的包装;因此，如果对基础集合进行了更改，包括添加或删除元素，则固定大小的集合将反映这些更改。A collection with a fixed size is simply a collection with a wrapper that prevents adding and removing elements; therefore, if changes are made to the underlying collection, including the addition or removal of elements, the fixed-size collection reflects those changes. 检索此属性的值的运算复杂度为 O(1)。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(1) operation.
